snippet: After voters in elections in France and Greece punished leaders pushing austerity, Europeans contemplated an untested political landscape shaped by demands for both austerity and growth.

byline.original: By ALAN COWELL and NICHOLAS KULISH
byline.contributor: Alan Cowell reported from Paris, and Nicholas Kulish from Berlin. Reporting was contributed by Elisabetta Povoledo from Rome, Raphael Minder from Madrid, Rachel Donadio from Athens, Andrew E. Kramer from Moscow, David D. Kirkpatrick from Cairo, Ravi Somaiya from London, and Douglas Dalby from Dublin.

lead_paragraph: After voters in elections in France and Greece punished leaders pushing austerity, Europeans contemplated an untested political landscape shaped by demands for both austerity and growth.

headline.seo: François Hollande’s Victory Sharpens European Austerity Debate
headline.main: Austerity Faces Sharper Debate After European Elections
headline.print_headline: Hollande Victory Sharpens European Austerity Debate
